content.html:
After two wonderful days in Stockholm attending Svelte Summit Fall 2022, I’m now heading back home.

An event filled with great talks and even greater people. Inspiring the whole community to make something new.

Bonus: Meeting people I’ve only known from Discord.

Hi! 👋
content.value:
After two wonderful days in Stockholm attending Svelte Summit Fall 2022, I’m now heading back home.
An event filled with great talks and even greater people. Inspiring the whole community to make something new.
Bonus: Meeting people I’ve only known from Discord.
Hi! 👋

content.html:
First day of Svelte Summit Fall 2022 over.

It’s been a fun event filled with great talks and nice people.
content.value:

It’s been a fun event filled with great talks and nice people.

Finally got around to watching Westworld season four, episode one. I’m hooked, again.

And as always, listening to Greetings From The Uncanny Valley as the episode finished. Makes the episodes that much better. 📺

content.html:
Listened to the latest episode of Really Specific Stories while out running tonight.

The guest in this episode was Manton Reece. A fun trip down memory lane.

Martin Feld has a fun show on his hands.

content.html:
18 years ago, I took my girlfriend out for breakfast. It was her birthday and I had a special day planned for her.

She’s now my wife and mother of my three kids. There are less time for these special days now.

But I still try to make it a good one.

Love you Kristi. ❤️
content.value:
18 years ago, I took my girlfriend out for breakfast. It was her birthday and I had a special day planned for her.
She’s now my wife and mother of my three kids. There are less time for these special days now.
But I still try to make it a good one.
Love you Kristi. ❤️

Another excellent entry in The Galactic Cold War series. I hope news of a new book will appear soon, because I want more!

content.html:
As WWDC approaches, I’m once again reminded of all the apps I’ve started and abandoned.

It’s so easy to be inspired by something new and click create new project. It’s exciting and you start to think of how you could use this in an app. You create more projects for different apps, and suddenly you’ve stopped working on it.

What will it be this year?
content.value:
As WWDC approaches, I’m once again reminded of all the apps I’ve started and abandoned.
It’s so easy to be inspired by something new and click create new project. It’s exciting and you start to think of how you could use this in an app. You create more projects for different apps, and suddenly you’ve stopped working on it.
What will it be this year?

content.html:
The final day of Premier League was football at its best.

The hope was lit after Villa had two goals and Man City had nil.

Liverpool won their game, but it wasn’t enough.

Still, great season by Liverpool and what a thrill this final game was.

And then we have Saturday… ⚽️
content.value:
The final day of Premier League was football at its best.
The hope was lit after Villa had two goals and Man City had nil.
Liverpool won their game, but it wasn’t enough.
Still, great season by Liverpool and what a thrill this final game was.
And then we have Saturday… ⚽️

content.html:
I’m currently studying to take the IAAP CPACC Certification. This will make me a “Certified Professional in Accessibility Core Competencies”.

I find the material really interesting. I’m learning a lot about the different obstacles that people with disabilities can face.
content.value:
I’m currently studying to take the IAAP CPACC Certification. This will make me a “Certified Professional in Accessibility Core Competencies”.
I find the material really interesting. I’m learning a lot about the different obstacles that people with disabilities can face.

content.html:
Craig Abbott has written one of the best posts about web accessibility I’ve read in a long time.

Lets be clear, WCAG 2.1 AA is a binary standard. You either pass all of the required criteria, or you don’t.

Partially supported is not supported
content.value:
Craig Abbott has written one of the best posts about web accessibility I’ve read in a long time.

Lets be clear, WCAG 2.1 AA is a binary standard. You either pass all of the required criteria, or you don’t.

Partially supported is not supported
